subject: Fashion
title: Red in Chinese Culture
description: A quick win: understand Red in Chinese Culture.

hook.text: Chinese brides wear red, not white. White is for funerals.

buildup.text: Red symbolizes luck, prosperity, and joy in Chinese culture for millennia.

discovery.text: Wearing red during Lunar New Year is believed to ward off evil spirits.

twist.text: Western fashion brands sometimes misuse Chinese red symbolism in insensitive campaigns.

climax.text: Chinese designers now reclaim red on global runways, redefining its narrative.

punchline.text: Same color, opposite meanings. Context is everything.

quiz.question: What does white traditionally symbolize in Chinese culture?
